name: Polka
description: Lively style and corresponding dance originating in Central and Eastern Europe, featuring a 2/4 cut time beat and instruments which vary by region.

children.name: Chicago Polka
children.description: Polish-American style known for slower tempo, improvisation and the ensemble typically including the clarinet, trumpet, and concertina.

children.description: Fast, urban Polish-American style performed by a Big Band-like ensemble.

children.name: Polka peruana
children.description: Peruvian adaptation of European Polka, blending Afro-Peruvian rhythms and criollo melodies.
